Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to explore Rome from”
Reviews.Author: EngYew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hassler for 3 nights in Rome in March. We had a deluxe room at the back of the hotel. The room was of good size and decorated in a tradition style. It appears to be an older room. The view of the balcony looks onto the side of the Trinità dei Monti. Two complimentary bottles of water were provided. WiFi is an addtional charge. (Tip: get a Telecom Italia TIM prepaid SIM card for free incoming calls and SMS and 30 days free unlimited internet for 12 Euros). We did not get breakfast included with our rate. Buffet breakfast at the hotel was 30 Euros per person. The Hassler is in such a fantastic location above the Spanish Steps. There are so many restaurant and cafes at the bottom of the Steps along Via delle Carrozze and Via della Croce. Every morning we would walk down the Steps and grab breakfast at one of the nearby cafes. Thick strong cappuccino and a pastry, eating while standing at the bar like most Italians. Every evening we would walk around exploring restaurants. Via Condotti is the high end shopping area in Rome and starts at the bottom of the Steps. We walked down Via Condotti to the Fontana di Trevi and then to Piazza Navona. On another day, after a tour of the Coliseum and Forum, we walked from the Monumento Nazionale back to the hotel. The buses are also very convenient and we took the bus back from Castle Sant'Angelo after visiting the Vatican. The Spagna metro is at the bottom of the Steps but we did not use it. Rome is a beautiful city rich in history and culture and the Hassler was the perfect place to explore it from.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect spot in Rome, stunning views from the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MsDavey
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suite.The restaurant justifies is status. Simply stunning food and service, with a view to die for. Our room was equally fabulous, lots of marble and gold in true over the top Italian style. Airport transfer by hotel limousine was friendly and graceful. Consierge helpful. Garden terrace a little dull and the rooftop pool not the best. But overall the view, the room and the food were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame of Rome. Elegant luxury.”
Reviews.Author: rover28
Reviews.Content: Still one of the grand old hotels of Europe. Luxurious and elegant. We booked through Amex Centurion and had a beautifully renovated (though a bit small) room with a balcony looking out over all of Rome. Service is understated and exquisite. If you remember and appreciate the good old days you will like it here. If you want trendy modern bells and whistles go somewhere else. Of course it is expensive. As it should be for the best location in Rome. Don't come here wearing shorts and sneakers and a baseball cap and complain.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: mitz81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply amazing! Staff is very courteous and always smiling. Room was very well appointed. Wireless Internet worked great for me. The location is THE BEST in Rome hands down. It is expensive but well worth it! If you can afford it I wouldn't think twice about it. The atmosphere brings you back a hundred years although the amenities are XXI centuries. What a great experience

Reviews.Title: “A hotel if you don't need email via wifi you laptop.”
Reviews.Author: z_banker
Reviews.Content: Very responsive reception staff, great location, great coffee in room service and concierge staff also excellent. The major glitch is worst internet access ever in a major five star hotel. Dial-up would have been far more useful thsn the frustration and valuable time is money wasting intermittent internet service. If you are a business person who uses the web, I would get a guarantee before paying the room charge in advance as I did. It made changing hotels to get web access not an option. I had to do email and financial transactions on my iPhone using the cellular data network. In my experience, this is far from a George V type of quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A review of the bar, not the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine H
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Rome last weekend and stayed at the Intercontinental on top of the Spanish Steps... really very mediocre with horrible service. Bad bar but fortunately the hotel is next to the Hassler Hotel so we went into their bar which is just fabulous - very "old Europe".... dark wood, well-appointed, charming servers. Have never stayed at the hotel (but now on my "to do" list) but the common areas are lovely - all beautifully appointed and maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hassler Roma”
Reviews.Author: Emasters5
Reviews.Content: Amazing service! Amazing view! The Hotel Hassler exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: Helen34438
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an awesome location right of the Spanish Steps where France meets Spain and shopping meets dining. Everybody were welcoming and pretty nice during our stay. There is a terrace which has gorgeous views of Rome and I believe you can dine or have a drink there when the weather permits. The room we had was a bit small. But it was done in very pleasant and warm colors. Bathroom had everything you would need. The breakfast room was very small again...I mean one morning we had to ''fight''for table, but nice buffet. There was a piano player in the evening and drinks and pizza were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautyfull views”
Reviews.Author: Eriksen90
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome with our 2 children. Hassler has a very good offer as they offer connecting rooms and with a 50% discount on the childrens room. We stayed in room 306 and 308 (grand de luxe rooms). 306 has 2 Windows with a wonderfull wiew to the Church of sct Peter. The rooms are spacius with wooden floors and quite big bathrooms. The interieur is all over old fashioned and in fact a bit ugly, but that is a bit of the charm of the hotel. But it is not trendy and modern. As you will expect service is perfect in an oldfashioned way. Breakfastbuffet is very nice with a lot of fresh fruit and juices. And finally the location is unbeatable whatever the purpose of your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Valerie C
Reviews.Content: Warm, inviting - that's the Hassler. Spending the week before Christmas with the Hassler staff was like being with family. The location, our sleeping room, the fine dining, the "best of the best" Concierge team and the warm and accommodating hospitality of the staff made our stay perfect - we will certainly be back and will recommend the Hassler to our friends and family - absolutely fabulous! We combined a business trip with a quick vacation and the Hassler made sure that we were given the true "Welcome to Italy".

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for View, Shopping, and Food.”
Reviews.Author: drddunn
Reviews.Content: Our Travel Agent choose this hotel for a quick weekend trip. The location was superb, with good shopping both on the top and below the Spanish Steps. Our room was huge and the service excellent. The bathrooms were particularly nice. It reminded me of how hotels were run in the past: excellent personal service, luxurious, and great attention to detail. Enjoyed one of the best dinners of my life. A visiting chef from Moscow collaborated with the current chef to host a two night night special dinner event. Food is always amazing in Italy, but this meal was extraordinary!! Each chef alternated plates and it just so happened we were visiting during truffle season...so you can only imagine our taste bud's happiness. I did experience something strange with the room service. First attempt to contact was unsuccessful, it just rang and rang. Hung up and next call was picked up instantaneously. Happened twice??? Our room was quiet, and I didn't hear any bells, so not sure about that. Prices were expected for this location and type of hotel. Make sure to ask about Breakfast, because I assumed it was a complete buffet for a set price, but rather certain food areas are included in the breakfast price, but others not. So, since I added a slice of salmon and an egg to my bread, I was charged the big price. A bit confusing, so I would clarify with the hostess. Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeK832655
Reviews.Content: The Hassler is one of the world's best hotels. The key here is to stay in a suite as the single rooms are too small. One of the best restaurants is on the top floor, with an astounding sunset view of the city. Since you are staying at the hotel, in a suite, you get the best tables. I stayed at the Forum Suite. I've been to Rome about a dozen times, once for over a month. This was my favorite hotel. One day, I was so exhausted, and my feet hurt so badly, I just ordered up some Caprezi salad and a spaghetti a la Amatriciana. Both were the best I ever had. Amazing. Obviously the service is perfect. The rooms exude elegant simplicity. The location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel, Fantastic Location, Fabulous View of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal152
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hassler for 4 nights before our Mediterranean cruise and we were extremely satisfied with the accommodations, location, and staff. First, the property is lovely! The lobby and sitting areas are decorated very grand and opulent and so was our room. Our room (was more of a suite) consisted of a large sitting area with couch, chair, desk and flat screen TV. Fabric covered all the walls and one wall of our room was covered with mirrors, we had 2 full closets, mini bar and fridge. A hallway and another storage area seperated the bedroom/sitting area from the bathroom. The bathroom was marble and had a separate toilet area. The first night our bed was 2 singles pushed together and we requested it be changed out with a king and the staff accommodated our request. The change in bed made our room perfect! The room was considered a deluxe and was extremely spacious for European standards. We overlooked the street in front of the hotel and the room was very quiet at night. (The windows have shutters internally and externally which when closed shut out any noise that may exist.) Each morning, I would open the shutters and windows and listen to the hustle bustle of the city waking up. We celebrated our first night in Rome with Champagne in our room complimentary of the Hassler! Second, Continental breakfast was included with our room rate and I am glad we choose this option. We had variety of fruits, cheese, specialty meats, croissants, breads, yogurt, cereal and juices. The coffee or cappuccino was delicious! (As it is everywhere in Italy). They also had a hot food section with eggs, bacon, pancakes, etc, but they would add 10 Euros per person for the hot food section. My husband ate the hot items some mornings and said they were very good. The wait staff was very prompt and friendly too. Third, the entire staff at this hotel was extremely helpful and friendly. We spoke to the concierge staff daily and they had great advice no matter what the topic. The reception staff took care of our every request. Every Hassler employee from the cleaning personnel to doorman would great us with bon jour! and a big smile. I read other reviews that the staff was pretentious, but we did not experience this at all. Finally, and most important – the Location! The location of this hotel cannot be surpassed. Literally top of the Spanish Steps and a view of Rome cannot be surpasses! We explored Rome from this hotel daily and you can walk to most locations very easily. We took a taxi to the Vatican and it was about a 10 minute ride. There is fabulous shopping at the bottom of the Spanish Steps so make sure you have several hours to explore the hustle and bustle of the shopping district and all top quality of the clothing and shoes (everything is made in Italy not China like in the US!!) We ate at several restaurants nearby from a local pizzeria to a fine ristorante’ – all great experiences. We never planned on where we would eat, just walk and look at the menus and then make our choice. Be sure to some time at the Villa Borghese which is a lovely park that truly takes you away from the busy streets of Rome. We spent half a day there walking and exploring and ate at little café there. Right next door to the Hassler is the Trinita dei Monti church with classic sculptures and abundant artwork and again, from the church steps, a view of Rome that is unsurpassed. Overall, the Hassler is a classy, 5 star hotel that deserves the respect of those that stay there. Please take note that any negative comments about this hotel or staff should be taken lightly. I would highly recommend this hotel and location to anyone that can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Grand but not great!”
Reviews.Author: Mary60898
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two great weeks in Italy. Our trip started in Florence and ended in Rome. Actually this is our last night here. After reading all the reviews of five star hotels in Rome I chose the Hotel Hassler. It is a beautiful hotel with a great location. The decor is Old World and lovely. Ok having said all that here are the issues. We asked for a renovated room that was quiet. We were given a nice room, very chic decor but the window faced the street and the noise was very loud, not good for sleeping. We asked to be moved to a quiet room and they were very nice in doing so. We moved our things and all was great until the bells at the church rang early ever morning. The walls are very thin and you could hear your neighbors as well as the things going on in the hall. We ordered room service one morning as we had an early Vatican tour it never arrived and no apology. Also our room at $900.00 a night included breakfast but charged you extra if you had eggs. Having stayed at many five star hotels in Asia and Europe, we found this surprising. Room service prices were somewhat high, and we did not use it as much as we would have liked. All the reviews talked about the location,but truly we checked out the Westin and the Marriott and some other hotels and for the price and more quiet location I would think twice. Great staff, location, decor but for quiet luxury not so great.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for view”
Reviews.Author: Quatschkopf9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the famous family run Hassler Hotel expecting something different from the international chain hotels you can literally find next door to this hotel. We were proven wrong. Nobody from the familiy showed up to at least say hello, just plenty of very freindly personel running around. The concierges are perfect! They were extremely helpful in suggesting restaurants that made a difference and were really Italian style. The concierge arranged for the best tourguide we ever had, the guide was a walking dictionnary. Wifi worked well and at no charge. We also tried the praised one star Imago restaurant on the roof top. Great view overlooking the city if you catch a window table. But clearly that evening it was no one star cuisine. Macarons filled with somethng fishy as pre starters, I guess macarons are really way out if you await inventive sophisticated cuisine. The pigeon was tasteless and topped with sticky sauce but the sorbettos were lovely. Very expensive view on Rome but exellent service! The room we had was lovely furnitured, spacy, clean with daily change of sheets. Welcome fruit basket, macarons(! again), still and sparkling water on the table on arrival. View from the room onto Rome skyline or Spanish Steps is very lovely in the early morning hours but at midnight (you can put the clock) garbage collecting is quite noisy. Breakfast is either in a lovely outside patio if weather permits or in the bar / library area. Funny to have breakfast sitting on sofas but also funny to find a breakfast buffet that could be anywhere than Rome. We missed the typical cornetto that you normally get in Italian bars. Same kind of fresh fruits and other products everyday - nothing changed at least as long as we stayed. Don´t ever ask anything exceptional or an early breakfast, the team of girls just cannot cope with this and ignore you, forget about service. Summary: If you are willing to spend a lot of money for a great view on Rome and enjoy the feeling staying in under the same roof than some celebrities did go for it. For everything else - maybe except for the concierge - you can find alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: bestmilano
Reviews.Content: STRUCTURE: perfect location in the most exclusive area of Rome. On top of the Spanish Steps, overlooks the city with its austere facade. Many rooms have views of Rome, others have a view of the courtyard. The hotel is first class, family-run preserves the authenticity of the good times, while respecting all the modern comforts. LOBBYING: I once was never make a change, I stayed at the hotel for at least six times in the last 10 years and the only thing that has changed personnel. Elegant, cozy breakfast room, I must say that it is the best breakfast I've ever done in a hotel, especially for the quality of products. ROOMS: as a regular customer I often offer great upgrades, they know my taste and know what I like best are the rooms (each room is different from one another). Some rooms have been renovated recently with decidedly more modern fabrics and furnishings. The beds are comfortable, good linen, and room service is exceptional. The waitresses are the plans of an extreme kindness and all Roman ladies of a certain age who have carefully prepared the rooms could do as a mother. RESTAURANT: amazing view, elegant, modern, romantic, ideal for private events. Kitchen modern and refined. Great service. Compulsory dinner jacket as they should do all the restaurants of a certain level. SWIMMING: No swimming pool. What I liked most: location, service, staff. What I like least: nothing. OVERALL: A great lady.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ... apart from the bar”
Reviews.Author: mark121
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a grand tour of Italy. So, I'll start this review by saying that we arrived on the Orient Express and also stayed in the Luna Hotel Baglioni in Venice, the Hotel Relais dell'Orologio in Pisa and Il San Pietro in Positano. All the hotels that we stayed in had free WiFi, which was very nice change from UK hotels! The Hassler is beautiful with an enviable location at the top of the Spanish Steps. Our room was fabulous ... a really good size, with an extremely comfortable bed, a small seating area and desk. It also had a large bathroom, complete with large bottles of good quality products and large cakes of soap that you can actually use (rather than the fiddly pea-sized things that you normally find). One small problem was the nail file, which had been pre-used. Yuk. The terrace at the top of the hotel is the perfect place for room service to come and serve you a drink, whilst you watch the sun set over beautiful Rome. The view is phenomenal. And getting room service to do the drinks is a lot better than going downstairs to the bar, where the waiters are much more interested in chatting with each other rather than serving. They seemed to find it strange that we wanted another round of drinks before dinner ... so strange that we had to send an envoy to walk up to the bar in order to attract anyone's attention. Then the second round of drinks arrived but without the olives and nuts being refreshed. That's pretty poor if you're paying nearly €100 for six drinks. My other gripe is the paying for breakfast. Not actually having to pay but having to wait for their amazingly antiquated system to print out a bill that I then need to sign. Most hotels simply check you in as you walk into breakfast, rather than worrying about signing bills. Make sure you eat in Imago, the restaurant in the hotel. Fabulous views, fabulous service and fabulous food. I'd certainly stay here again ... but I'd stick to room service and the top terrace for any drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Jon Dunn
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you can afford it. It is worth it. Great Property at top of Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but a great location”
Reviews.Author: chevydallas
Reviews.Content: It has been thirty years since my last visit to Rome. Just a reminder all the attractions and even the streets and sidewalks overflowed with thousands of tourists. I mean it was more crowed than any place I have been including Disney. The entire city reminded me of exiting an NFL football stadium that went into OT. We stayed four nights in a courtyard view grand delux king. The room was large with purple velvet decor. The bath was all slab marble and very nice except the jets in the tub didn't work the first night. The restaurant on the top floor, Imagio, has excellent views but certainly not worth 290 euros for two (the sparking water charge was 32euro). Everything in the hotel including the rooms was overpriced. The room was 830 euros with tax and breakfast. The front desk service was fine but slow. Housekeeping never answered its phone. No coffee in the room. You must request feather pillows. The hotel is old, but elegant and it appeared remodeled. The common area decor consist of antiques that are really special. The elevators are the smallest and slowest in Italy. The fitness area is really small and inadequate for weights, but has a neat balcony attached with chaise lounge chairs overlooking the city and the Spanish steps. The location is great. The breakfast in the courtyard was great; beautiful setting and the staff there were eager to please and moved fast. The Internet was free and fairly fast.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: LPK1
Reviews.Content: The Hassler Roma is a grand hotel in probably the best location you can imagine, directly at the top of the Spanish Steps. It occupies the best position of any hotel in the area. Simply walk out the front door and you are in the middle of Rome. No compromise. When you exit the hotel you in any direction you are in Rome! Even the little square off to the front side of the hotel is charming with restaurants and shops. The hotel itself is charming and every bit of 5 star. The service at all levels is outstanding. The restaurant is excellent, the front desk staff and the concierge without compromise. Expensive, yes but worth every penny...i mean euro!

Reviews.Title: “Great position but - some staff need to be less condescending”
Reviews.Author: annagram09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hassler Hotel Rome for 4 nights in August. This hotel is in an excellent position at the top of the Spanish Steps and handy to many places in Rome. This is the best feature about this hotel. It has a formal old world appearance and, but a little tired in some areas such as the Palm Court which needs updating. The Restaurant Imago on Level 6 has a 1 star Michelin rating and was a very special experience. The view over Rome is superb and the food and service excellent. It is extremely expensive but for a special treat, unique! Our room was comfortable and spacious with a good sized bathroom but dated. If you ignored some of the chipped and marked floor and ugly brown bathroom tiles then it was fine. The room was well serviced with clean towels but like another reviewer, a damp cleaning cloth was left on a shelf in our room! It soon disappeared once I placed outside our door. The room overlooked the interior courtyard and the Palm Court restaurant but it looks run down with dirty walls. The some of the concierge staff were helpful with advice for shopping and bookings but some had a superior attitude. It was obvious that there 2 classes of guests staying in the hotel. The best rooms had two special lifts close to the Reception Desk while the lift at the end of the hallway was for the lesser rooms that were dated and obviously not as expensive as the ones at 1600E ($2000 AU) a night. On checking out we were surprised to find that an extra 10% for tax had been added to our account and politely queried this. We had stayed for 3 weeks in Italy on this holiday and this was the first hotel that did not have the tax included in the quote. However we did not argue when it was explained and paid up but the Reception staff were quite condescending in response. We asked for our bags to be brought down from our room but after waiting 15 minutes we had to find the porter ourselves and ask him personally to collect our bags because we wanted to get to the airport on time. The porter was very obliging and embarrassed that he had not been given the message to collect our bags. Fortunately every other hotel in Italy extended this assistance to us on our departure as a matter of routine with a gracious manner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room with HUGE Balcony.”
Reviews.Author: gwizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 for our anniversary. They did everything they could to make it special. Upgraded room to look out over the Vatican and Spanish Steps. Nice king size bed and bathroom although the room itself was small. Very nicely decorated but an older hotel. They had fruit and bottled water available for us during our stay. I think our room was the adjoining room to a large penthouse suite. The balcony was lovely and the views were awesome. We walked everywhere from here and had many restaurant options.

Reviews.Title: “Worst high end hotel I've ever stayed in.. So much for 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Y
Reviews.Content: This hotel was completely over priced for what you got and had terrible service. I have travelled all over the world and usually have stayed in very high end hotels as I work in the travel industry. The Hassler was a complete waste if money and had none of the customer service, extra services and good food you expect with a 5 star hotel. We payed over 500 euro a night for a 3 night stay. Upon arrival there was a distinct attitude given by the front desk staff. I don't know if it may have been because I was traveling with my mother, just the two of us, or what. But right from the beginning I got a bad vibe. They showed us to the room which was very small and did nit have the proper bed we had reserved for, but we were told there were no other rooms available. The first morning we were woken up at 8am by the housekeeping staff being terribly noisy in the room next door. After complaining we were told it would be resolved but the noise continued on and happened the next morning as well. The food I can't even describe how horrible it is. First off we order a chicken and avocado sandwich to room service which was 20€ and when it comes it's a ham and lettuce sandwich, when we send it back they say "oh well there was no avocado". Wouldn't it of then been a good time to call up and ask us if we wanted something else? After bringing us a diff kind of sandwich over 25 mins later they still charged us for it. Not to even mention that it looked like the simple kind of sandwich you would pack in a kids lunch. The buffet in the morning was small and overpriced and to have any kind of drink on the courtyard at night, even a coke it was 10€ for a skinny glass with ice in it. The rooms were not very clean, there was lotion from someone else all along the bathroom wall, and smudges in the glass part of the shower. The walls are so thin you could hear everyone in the halls or rooms next to you. And the lights are difficult to control as most of the switches in our room didn't work. Over all the location is the only great part of the hotel, but there was at least 7 other hotels within a few blocks that I'm sure would be cheaper, friendlier, cleaner and have better food. Don't waste your time. Overall

Reviews.Title: “True 5 star luxury in the eternal city!”
Reviews.Author: cormarToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not come cheap. However if you are looking for a true luxury experience with all the associated amenities, location and service and go out of their way staff this is it! We called this property at 10 pm at night as we were leaving the hotel we had originally checked into due to no AC and mechanical issues and misleading reviews and pictures and zero value for your money. Thankfully Elizabeth at the reception answered my call. She understood our issue, and need to find a suitable room fast for three days. She immediately offered us a room and would stay until we arrived to ensure we were settled and happy in the room. She even offered to show us the room even before we committed. She never asked for cc# or cell #. Just my name and she would take care of us upon arrival. 20 minutes after leaving our bad experience we were taken to a lovely air conditioned room overlooking their palm court. She even called room service and told them to wait for us as we were hungry and she knew the kitchen was almost closing. We ordered food and it arrived in what seemed like minutes along with a lovely fruit tray and champagne tom welcome us. All of this considering we had called out of the blue in one of their busiest times for tourists in Rome. Concierge is great honest and provided us with a private tour guide at short notice at very reasonable rates. Doorman is extremely helpful, nice and welcoming. All staff here smile, and look to please you and are not in your face. This is what service is. Hotel is well located beautifully appointed. The room we were given was renovated spotless and the bed is exceptional. Breakfast buffet in the garden is quiet and perfect for starting your day. A little bit of everything. Previous reviewers mention snobby staff and cold reception and little value, we have no idea what they are talking about. Before you can say buenosera or ciao the staff beat you to it. Hassler will see us again on our next trip to the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton A
Reviews.Content: It was my second in Rome. First hotel was a bit dissapointing. However Hotel Hassler was much better especially the staff if I compare. The Rome's overall service is very low since they are full of tourist all time. Rooms of Hassler Hotel was acceptable and location was also handy.

Reviews.Title: “The One and Only Hassler in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jce326
Reviews.Content: The Hassler made our Rome vacation all the more unforgettable. The Hotel is simply magnificent from the lobby area, restaurants, room, and we love The Palm Court! Our room was beautiful, very clean and very quiet (slept peacefully!). We received everywhere an impeccable, personalized and high quality of service from the staff. To experience a one of a kind elegance and luxury again, we will definitely be coming back to The Hassler again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SRD18
Reviews.Content: This is not the cheapest of options for a trip to rome but it is a wonderful treat. Our room was beautiful - there was a view but not that it mattered because we were out a lot and it couldn't be seen from teh bed for example. The Palm court is lovely for breakfast or afternoon tea. Room service was perfect. All the staff were pleasant and helpful. (Except for one of the waiters in the afternoon in the palm court who was a bit supercilious, but that was his problem.)

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJack99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because i heard good things and everyone knew this hotel. I travel a lot and I never do reviews. Firstly I would say the hotel paid people for the good reviews they have since April. This hotel one of the most expensive hotels must receive alot of complaints because they were very good at ignoring my complaints Firstly I had a grand deluxe room. The most expensive under a suite. I didn't realize grand deluxe includes rooms overlooking a dirty wall. They call it courtyard. In america we call it overlooking the back alley. Secondly the noise from the staff in the morning woke me up 2 nigh in a row. They said hey would talk to the staff. The staff I guess never knew the walls are paper thin and yelling on phone at 7am wasn't a good idea. The reviewer in march was given a box of CHOCLATE. He did better than me I got a cold stare like it's too bad. My travel agent didn't do any better. It's almost same story as April 2011 reviewer. I would recommend staying elsewhere to HHS point if you reserved here cancel while you can.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lgracek
Reviews.Content: Even though the Hassler is not necessarily my style--I'm a fan of the modern-minimalist aesthetic, this hotel is amazing. For the views alone on the guest-only terrace bar, the price is worth it. So romantic! Everyone who worked at the Hassler was extremely helpful, and made excellent restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “The Hassler never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: MisterW10021
Reviews.Content: In my profession, my travel schedules are extensive and I am privileged to stay in the greatest hotels in the world. In Rome, there is only one destination and that is The Hassler. It has been my honour to know Roberto Wirth for many years. The standard set by him and his team is impeccable. I always know I will be received with great courtesy and consideration. An absolute 10.

Reviews.Title: “Very attentive”
Reviews.Author: spimfa
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location (without the crowd) and very attentive service. Rooms are a little tight but the hotel upgraded us so no complaints there too... What really sets the hotel apart is the service which is amongst the best I've seen !

Reviews.Title: “It is the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Chris
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hasssler could not have been more helpful. They went out of the way to make our stay a pleasant one. The hotel is very exclusive and yes many famous people stay there. The police out the front and the odd viewing of the said famous people reinforce this. It is thoroughly charming and very picturesque. It is also not as super expensive as the best hotels of Paris, New York, Tokyo or London. BUT you really need to choose your room. Lesson 1 - there are rooms that are renovated and rooms that are not! They quickly moved us to a better room from our un-renovated monster which was lovely of them because I was going to cry if I had to stay in room105. They also moved us to an even more modern room on the second day while we were out segwaying! Lesson 2 - don't ask for the view of the Spanish steps. The garden view rooms were all booked out for a reason. Rome is noisy ( we had a car alarm keep us awake for an hour one night) and the road at the top of the Spanish steps/ the base of the hotel is a very busy one, strangely. Go to the restaurant Imago to experience the view! The standard of luxury hotels in Rome is not what I would expect in a major tourist destination. We have stayed in one other on a previous occasion and walking the streets as you do in this city, it becomes pretty clear that there is a certain rustic charm to all of the hotels. You have to accept that you are going to get character. So, what should you get from my review? I really do believe that the Hassler is one of the best that Rome has to offer and the service was flawless, but make sure you ask for what you want. Is a modern bathroom important? Do you expect a renovated room? You can only ask. We did, and the staff were stunning in trying to accommodate our needs.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Carabao73
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to say but The Hotel Hassler meets its reputation of being the BEST hotel. The staff are warm, friendly, helpful and attentive. Nothing can beat the location. It is just perfect! The room which we had was elegantly designed, and very clean. Very quiet, one can sleep soundly especially that the bed is comfortable. I would definitely go back to The Hotel Hassler and recommend it to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views and stylish rooms, at a price!”
Reviews.Author: valepix
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and my extended family used this hotel as a base when celebrate our wedding in Rome last here. We chose the Hassler because of its position (we were getting married at a venue nearby) and were immediately by the views, the standards of the rooms and the levels of service. However, as I got ready for the wedding in this hotel, we order room service for lunch - I think it was 4 sandwiches, 2 portions of chips and some sparkling water - the bill came to over €80... Also, I used the hairdresser and make up artist from the hotel and it was a bit of a nasty surprise. He ended up charging almost 4 times what he had originally quoted and my hair came undone whithin half an hour of me walking down the aisle. Having said this, I would highly recommend the Hassler to anybody looking for an amazing location and romantic, sweeping views across Rome

Reviews.Title: “Cynically exploited, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: nylatraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent four days in Rome and decided to book the Hassler through my Virtuoso travel agent. The Hassler is expensive, but the hotel came well-recommended and Virtuoso guests are usually privy to upgrades. The Hassler is a lovely if smallish old property with a prime location near the Spanish Steps. When I arrived, they showed me my upgrade. A tiny room on the second floor overlooking the street. (Nice bedspread and a wall hanging, but subpar in terms of size and amenities. In a word, disappointing.) It was noisy, and I wouldn't have been able to sleep. They then offered me my "original room", which they said was one of their new ones. This one was on the first floor and overlooked their restaurant courtyard. I am a world traveler. I have stayed at rooms in luxury hotels all over the world. This was the smallest, saddest room I have ever seen. 225-250 square feet, with adjoining bathroom. Walls painted white. No decorations. Small plasma. Quite simply, an outrage. I was told this was the only other room they had available. They were sold out. But since I was there for four nights, they would try to move me. I took the room because it was quiet. (The woman at the hotel front deskl said "No one told us you wanted a quiet room.") I contacted my travel agent. She said she would talk to the hotel. That day, radio silence from the Hassler. Then, the next night -- halfway into my stay -- a bottle of wine and some chocolates appeared with a note: "Sorry you are unhappy with your room. We will try to move you as soon as something else becomes available." And that was the last I heard from the good people at the Hassler. Four nights, 600 plus per night, and a room that would have angered you had you been given it at a Motel 6. All of which left me feeling cynically exploited and ruined my stay. Now, the Hassler does have some very lovely rooms. I know, because I saw them. But perhaps if you are not paying 1000 a night, you don't get them. Nearby, for less money, you can stay at the Sofitel and the Eden, and get fantastic rooms. The apathy, unfortunately, extended to the concierge. When I arrived, I explained that I like eating at Michelin star restaurants. But given the fact that I was exhausted, could he recommend something local? He packs me off to a nearby place that specialized in meat. The place was overrun with Americans. What's worse -- it was so crowded that despite my "reservation", I couldn't even get the restaurant to take my name. (A passing waiter said the restaurant was "on fire", a reference to how busy it was.) So after fifteen minutes, I walked back to the hotel and got the concierge to make a reservation at another local restaurant. I got a table promptly. But the food was mediocre. On the plus side, they have wireless internet -- for $28/night. My advice is to make damn sure about the room you are getting before you book a reservation. And if you are not a VIP or a dignitary -- or paying a king's ransom --do not expect to be treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: TexasGal7890
Reviews.Content: This hotel was sort of a disappointment. I was originally put in a standard room that was really dated and the bed was saggy. Due to a noxious odor that caused my eyes to water i was placed in a room that had been updated. What a difference that made. If they had not moved me to the updated room i would have moved to another hotel. The location is the only part of this hotel I thought was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LesleyRandall
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hassler was perfect in so many ways. Location, Location, Comfort and Service We used the bikes to spend a wonderful afternoon at the park Borghese. The paths are pedestrian and bike friendly. The museums in the park(may need to buy tickets in advance!) are wonderful and the scenery and gardens second to none. I highly suggest this. The view out our window of the spanish steps was great! Great view of the Vatican too! (in the distance) The restaurant at the top of the Hassler was wonderful. The food and service incredible and amazingly not too stuffy. The rooms are very clean and well maintained and accomodations very comfortable. Many european and american ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: bouji
Reviews.Content: Hotel offers some of the best views in Rome. Restaurant is OK, but not worth the money. Rooms are a bit dated, could do with the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: zajhbfemme
Reviews.Content: The one and only hotel to stay at in Rome, with undoubtedly THE best location in the entire city. The famous Spanish steps are a mere 10 footsteps out of the door leading to the luxury shopping lane of Via Condotti and numerous yummy gelatos - it doesnt get better than this!! The hotel is within walking distance to the bustling city and numerousother attractions and restaurants. The piazza at the hotel is beautiful and perfect for outdoor dining. The rooms are tastefully decorated albeit a tad old-fashioned, which only added to the charm of the hotel. The staff were helpful and the food was great although pricey! The hotel also had quite an imressive fitness centre. As above, this is THE only hotel to stay at when in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: detroitmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hassler for five nights over US Thanksgiving week. We were in room 310 looking over the front of the hotel and the Spanish Steps. Lovely linens, great shower pressure, bath sheets on a heated bar. The location near Via Condetti was great for shopping. The Vatican is a 40 minute walk as is the Colosseum, etc. The staff (hats off to Ricardo) could not have been more helpful with dinner reservations, Mass schedules and general inquiries. We are planning our return trip to Rome for this spring and will certainly make the Hotel Hassler our home base.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Alain-london72
Reviews.Content: The Hassler is old style luxury hotel which is very rare now in the world. This hotel has great service, location and beautiful rooms. After 2 days at the Eden this felt like heaven. I trully recomend staying there, concierge are very helpful as well. Had a great stay there and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Il Palazetto - a winner!”
Reviews.Author: laomaggiore
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 2 of the 4 rooms in this delightful building that stands apart but is run by the Hotel Hassler. The rooms are considerably bigger than in the hotel and beautifully decorated with views of the Spanish Steps from your window. The ground floor has the Wine Academy where you can book a wine tasting. The rooms are on the upper floors with a small restaurant and an open air wine bar on the roof. Do not be daunted when you are first shown to your room the stairs/lift are small but the rooms delightful. The staff are very attentive. Breakfast is served in the Hotel Hassler (about 50yds away). For me it was a disappointment with none of the charm that often accompanies Italian breakfasts. There is a balcony on the 7th floor of the Hotel Hassler which has beautiful views over Rome and is open to anyone staying in the hotel or Il Palazetto - go there late afternoon, order a couple of drinks and watch the sun go down - you may well have it all to yourself !

Reviews.Title: “Location & Staff Top Marks!”
Reviews.Author: KTBSMU
Reviews.Content: Very friendly concierge team.. can't remember the gentleman's name.. Room was good size ,clean & confortable. Breakfast - great selection... stone throw from all the sights of Rome. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hassler- Yes! One of the Best Hotels in the World”
Reviews.Author: aa6nz
Reviews.Content: First of all don't believe the negative reviews about the Hassler. We stayed here prior to our Holyland cruise on. The courtyard breakfast and expresso was the best I have ever had. We were greeted each morning by name for breakfast where we were surrounded by elegence and class. While we were there Spanish royalty and a former US Governor were guests at the hotel and we had the opportunity to speak to the Governor. Our room had a view of the Spanish steps and the Vactican Dome and at night it was enchanting. The bed was so comfortable, and the bathroom was all white marble with the strongest water pressure shower I had in Europe. The lobby was very elegent and the sitting areas and the stairway were lined with beautful rugs, drapery and carpets. This is one of those hotels where you feel its just a honor staying there and when you tell people where you are staying they stand up and take note! Review my review of the Hotel Aldrovandi- I cancelled my reservation there immediately after going into the Hassler and being greeted by the desk staff, Roberto who was first class and secured the room I had dreamed of with a view to die for. The Hassler Hotel a special place for a special City, Roma! When I return to Rome I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I am going back!”
Reviews.Author: sanddoc
Reviews.Content: I traveled by myself to Rome in late August. Not my first visit. However, the Hassler Hotel was the best - all around perfect yet discreet. Concierge staff wonderful. Returning at the end of Sept. 2010, and made plans to stay for 6 nights. Perfect location. Clean,. beautiful rooms with incredible bedding. Room service was impeccable. I cannot wait to go back, and I am sure that I will feel welcomed!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing service thank you Mr. Wirth”
Reviews.Author: Jasonkiran
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed here for 6 nights and from the moment we walked into the front doors we were treated like movie stars. We were taken to our room which was a newly renovated room with a terrace. I honestly would have paid double if I was aware of the size and quality of the room given the location. My wife suffers from a celiac disease and the hotel staff catered for this in every way which surpassed our every expectation. The staff are attentive to every detail and the quality of service is second to none. The hassler made our stay in Rome extra special. We even got to meet Mr writh himself on his request. I strongly recommend staying at this hotel, it is one of the best in europe. Thank you so much

Reviews.Title: “the location and only one hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: michael_zrh
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Hassler after 20 years. Still, the location is unsurpassed. also the ambiance and the great hall. very discrete for the people who don't need pomp and circumstances. got an immediate room upgarde to a lovely deluxe room with views of the city. roomsize good enough, only the mineral water got not stocked up for the second and thrid night ... the restaurant & terrace has fantastic views and great service staff. next time in rome means next time at the hassler.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hassler for one night at the end of our trip to Italy (we had spent the previous week on the Amalfi Coast). It was perfect. Loved the location and the hotel staff was top notch. When we arrived we were given a very nice room, but it did not have a view. I asked about another and they found one for us that still required cleaning but had a view. We went out to explore Rome (after receiving some very helpful information from the conceirge) and came back to a wonderful room with balcony that overlooked the Spanish Steps. It was romantic and magical and the perfect spot to end a great stay in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “nice location - well appointed room”
Reviews.Author: xolo90
Reviews.Content: We ended our 10 day visit in Italy with a 3 day stay at Hotel Hassler. After staying a 5 days in a non air conditioned home in Lucca, Hotel Hassler provided a welcomed change. The first day, we just stayed in the room and slept in comfort. The suite was very nice and my children enjoyed the room. 1500 euro per night the internet should have been free (complaint!) Located at the top of the Spanish steps and near shopping areas, it was well centralized to the city and the attractions we wanted to see. The morning breakfast area was charming and the selection of food reasonable. The hotel staff met our needs and was pleasant. We would consider a return trip should we want to spend freely again on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Memories”
Reviews.Author: lovequality
Reviews.Content: This review is unlike no other because of the circumsatances. My family of origin stayed here in the 1968. We had a suite on the top floor which was stately and elegant with amazing views ! The service was top notch and we had no problems with cleanliness as I have read about in CURRENT reviews. The food was excellent, and room service was divine ! My son just left for Rome tonight with his bride for their 3 week honeymoon. Because of my wonderful experience, he booked a room on the top floor. After reading some of these very negative reviews, I must say that I am regretting suggesting the Hassler to them. I can only hope that they have great accomodations and leave with the unforgettable memories that I have. If that is not the case, I will feel responsible for a their less than acceptable experience. I am so disappointed to hear how once such a desireable Hotel has changed so drastically. Ahhh.........the good old days........CIAO !

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: golfbob
Reviews.Content: makes american hotels look lame everything perfect Staff is terrific. Food excellent although pricey. 35 euro for 2 coffes and an after dinner drink. Very friendly nice elegant hotel in perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geetika
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hassler was a lovely boutique hotel. The service was wonderful. It was lovely to feel at home and safe in a city that is not always so! The business center with two computers with free internet was wonderful! (It is not as easy to find free wi fi spots with the restrictions requiring ID for internet access). The small fitness center is adequate and convenient and more than I would expect for a boutique hotel. The only down side was the shower glass did not prevent a lot of water splatter. This seemed to be a problem in other European hotels I have stayed in as well, so I am not sure if it is a unique issue. The restaurant on the sixth floor is expensive - the less known secret is that you can bring your own wine and sit on the sixth floor terrace and even order room service! I did that my last evening - a beautiful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hassel”
Reviews.Author: jss25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our 2 week Italy vacation here, and were very, very disappointed in this hotel, so disappointed that we re-named it the HOTEL HASSLE, because everything was a hassle. We stayed in 5 star hotels throughout Italy, and 4 out of the 5 hotels that we stayed in were all LHW hotels, and they did not disappoint, until this one!!! The reception when we checked in showed us around the hotel, showed us where breakfast was served, and explained that it was included in our rate, then we were taken to our room, which she told us was also upgraded (if this room was considered an upgrade, then I'd hate to see what our original room would have been like). Our room was filthy- garbage still in the trash can, dusty and overall very dark and small. I'm not sure why they have turn down service, because I am not sure exactly what they do, because the only thing that was done when we had it was that the pillows from on top of the bed were "thrown" into a corner of the room, not even put away nicely in the closet. For what this hotel charges, they didn't even provide water at turn down, which EVERY other hotel that we stayed in did. Next problem that we had was the next morning when we went to breakfast. There was a breakfast buffet, (no big deal), which included pastries, salami's, cheeses, and 2 chafing dishes of hot food, 1 eggs, and 1 with bacon (which there was never enough of because every time they filled it, by the time I got to it, it was gone). Again, all throughout our trip, we stayed in 5 star hotels, which included breakfast, with buffets just like this one, and even better. At the end of breakfast we were given a bill, in which we questioned, they said that only the pastries were included in our rate, and since we had "hot" food we would be charged an extra 10 euros. DISGUSTING is the first word that comes to mind when I think about this and what happened. Not only were we not told about this, but when we questioned them, they became so rude and argumentative, certainly not what you would expect from a 5 stay Luxury Hotel such as this one. We wound up going to the front, and again, the gentlemen became argumentative, and stated that hot food was not inlcuded, and we should have been told. A hotel of this class, should be ashamed of themselves. 500 euros a night, and to offer a what they call a buffet, and only allow some guest to have hot food is ridiculous!!! And to then argue with customers is even worse in my opinion. We didn't have time to speak to the manager as we had a tour reserved, but when we got back we spoke to the front desk manager, who was already briefed on what had happened, and did do the right thing, by removing the charge, and apologizing, but still that was not the point. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. A friend of mine warned us not to stay here, and to stay at the DeRussie, but unfortunately we did not listen, as we thought the location of this hotel was great, and thought how bad could it be, as it was LHW, and has been around for a while. All I can say is I wish we had listened!!! I will say I did like the location, but not enough to overcome everything else that happened here. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: ghtraveller
Reviews.Content: we spent one night in this hotel. It was really lovley. We were given a room on the 5 th floor overlooking the Spanish steps. We had a small balcony and it was the perfect place to sit and watch the world go by. Getting out on to the balcony was tricky was the door had a security handle which we could not operate. we called for help and the person who dealt with out inquiry appeared cross that we were not able to open a door. He reluctantly appeared to show us how to operate the door. This was the only negative of the saty - they unhelpful demonstartor of door opening. The room was interesting and very art deco. I loved it but I can see it is perhaps not to everyones tast. The bathroom was also fine with a good shower and a very intersting bath tub. Mineral water was suppled which was a nice touch. Breakfast was outside in the court yard. It was adequate but not an extensive menu. IThe quality was good and the staff attentive. we ate in the resteraunt on the 6th floor that has panoramic viewsof Rome. The meal was expensive but what an experience. It was a truly wonderful meal - the food excelent and the service immpecable. Weended the evening in the salon downstairs listening to the pianist. He was great and the bar staff were fun and friendly. Yes a great place to stay. Expensive but great.

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: floramalone
Reviews.Content: The Hassler is in the most perfect position in Rome. Yes, the street outside is busy and noisy with cars and people but that's Italy. It's at the top of the Spanish Steps, with spectacular views over the Rome skyline from some rooms. This is not the hotel for you if you want something modern. It's an old-world hotel, in an old-world (wonderful) location. Some of the rooms are very beautiful, with rich colours and lovely textiles. Cleaning was not as good as one expects from this class of hotel - floor in bedroom and hall always had very visible flecks of dirt on them; someone else's short thick hair on a shelf in the bathroom during the whole of a 3 day stay; and tired, slightly grubby paintwork, despite a relatively recent renovation.... The public areas are very disappointing. Some walls have mosaic tiles which must date from the 1930's, which are very attractive, if not everyone's taste. The rest, however, is a jumble of styles and heavy colours - shiny black and white; heavy 1980's reds. The furniture in the lobby and next to the garden restaurant, particularly some yellow sofas, are tired and dirty. Net curtains on the windows in the loos downstairs badly needed cleaning. The garden at the back is potentially gorgeous but the paintwork is faded, the awning dirty and the furniture very tired. The staff at the reception, the concierges and the room staff were charming and incredibly helpful, with one or 2 exceptionally helpful people (the events manager is excellent, charming and unflappable). The indoor and garden restaurants staff at lunchtime were pretty sloppy - very slow in bringing menus. One can be happy to wait for food to be cooked freshly but not to wait for the waiter all the time - even getting a menu took about 10 minutes every time. Rome is not famous among Italians for food but considering how well one can eat in Italy for relatively little, the food is very mediocre. The mark-up on wines is enormous. On a more positive note, contrary to another review, the breakfast was absolutely plentiful and delicious with a lot of choice. Pretty expensive at 31 Euros for the basis breakfast or 52 Euros for the full cooked breakfast. The hotel has a lot of charm, is in a wonderful location but really needs someone to pull it together. The beautiful bedrooms hidden away are let down by the terrible public areas. It would be a tremendous shame if it was completely turned into a shiny new hotel but much more effort needs to be put into making the whole thing look loved and into ensuring that every aspect and every detail, including the food, are impeccable. The overwhelming suspicion is that this is a once-wonderful hotel, that has turned into a cash cow due to its reputation and location with an endless supply of tourists. Other hotel in other cities (like the Bristol in Paris or the Beau-Rivage in Geneva) are also family-owned but are a million miles ahead in terms of cleanliness and standards across every aspect of the hotel. Could and should do much better.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: lucrezia2010
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Hassler in the 1970's with my parents, who had honeymooned there. we visited the Hassler as a family about 6 times. This hotel has always had a special place in my heart, so i was delighted to see that it is still the wonderful landmark it was back then. It has a charm and warmth that no other hotel has, and the staff are so helpful that you are made to feel like part of one, big harmonious family. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I just hope to get back there quickly again. if you have the opportunity to visit, count yourself lucky. I have stayed at the Hotel du Russie near Piazza del Popolo, which is also nice but nothing measures up to the Hassler. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vannah0306
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Hassler for 8 nights and it was absolutely fabulous. The location could not be better...right by the Spanish Steps. The rooms were beautifully appointed. The reception staff and the concierge service was impeccable. The top floor restaurant (though pricey) is not to be missed. Another close by (and inexpensive) restaurant that we enjoyed several times is Al 34. Another tip....when in Rome use Romaround tours to see the Coliseum, Palatine Hill, Catacombs, and Vatican Museum. For me, having a knowledgeable and entertaining tour guide made the ruins and ancient sites so much more than just a pile of bricks.

Reviews.Title: “location and thats it!”
Reviews.Author: JoyGress
Reviews.Content: returned from a three day easter break at hassler. location cannot be beat for hi end shopping and local dining. I must say that the hotel itself is tired and service could be a bit better , espiceally at the restaurants. breakfast buffet not special at all for 41 euros a person. very difficult to get coffee or like in am . Staff unfriendly and could not be bothered. rooms clean, but dated . tub dose not drain with shower , tv small and difficult to work. No good area for drinks after day of touring. All in all, not to many great hotels in rome and this one pales in comparison to mandarin in munich or four seasons in other european cities. The area around hotel is loud with cabs and somewhat dirty. fitness center a joke

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: siddhasites
Reviews.Content: The restaurant on the top floor has the best view of Rome and the food and service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Just the legend is left....”
Reviews.Author: magvictoria
Reviews.Content: We chose this legendary property for our anniversary short stay and having been there before just for the restaurant I was looking forward to our stay at Hassler. To most of people is sounds like 'the best', 'the perfect one'..... I didn't felt it...unfortunately. I stayed in many properties in Rome and Italy, and I can compare. The bathroom of our 'upgraded' deluxe room was really tiny with 1 sink (not two as often). The room itself on the small side with a narrow window though had amazing view. The DVDplayer didn't work, in the evening turndown service is limited with preparing the bed - no chocolates, no free water. But lovely Hassler labled small bottles of water are offered on the workdesk in the room to 'take with you for your long strolles over the city' for only 4Eu. The bed was absolutely lovely! The breakfast is a mess. They are always ready with a printed bill for the 'full american buffet' for you to sign (app 40 Eu pp)...even if you got a croissant, some juice and slice of pineapple and a coffee. The buffet is primitive..... shame for the hotel wich is supposed to be 'the best of Rome". No prosecco to make mimosas for the breakfast as in most of really good 4 and 5 hotels. But the biggest dissappointment was to feel the lack of atmosphere and the absence of 'real italian hospitality'. Or......maybe I should have booked one of Grand Deluxe Suites for a week to feel the real hospitality?? No..I'd better stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Roman Holidays glamour”
Reviews.Author: oliviercale
Reviews.Content: A liitle run down but still managed as an old world class hotel it once was. Incredible location/ views, rooms are a bit cramped & aged but part of a certain charm there...Suites are the greatest value for money, restaurant has no interest. Fares are overall reasonnable compared to Rome standards.Concierge service top notch.Go fot this classic !

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: djkginger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hassler for the final 3 days of our 10 day Italy trip. Our room was immediately upgraded upon our arrival, with beautiful city views, bottle of champagne, etc. This hotel is exquisite, staff is very accomodating, and location is in the heart of Rome. Walking distance to everything, subway located one block away, and easy to navigate. Restaurant is very expensive, but more affordable eateries are only blocks away. We were able to walk to Coliseum, Pantheon, and many other required destinations. Day or night, we felt quite comfortable navigating the beautiful streets of this eternal city. A bit pricey, but if this is your one trip to Rome, go for it, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very refined”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: There are a few other luxury options in Rome, but the Hassler is probably the only traditional family-run top hotel left. Unlike some other reviewers, I found the hotel to be in excellent condition, with a balance between the historic atmosphere and modern comfort. At a time when most luxury hotels use every space for business, the Hassler has a large lounge - called the reading room - leading to the Palm Court. The suite, with a double view (partial city view and full view towards the gardens of the Villa Medici and the nearby school) was decorated in a very individual style, with silk fabric on the wall and the pattern repeated throughout the room (including on the paper basket!). The bathroom was very elegant (no separate shower, though, unlike in the Grand Deluxe rooms), and, unusually, there was natural day light in the bathroom and in the separate (and very large) toilet. All the details, like the quality of the toiletries (own brand, Amorvero), of the towels and of the bed linen, were of the highest level. The bar - where smoking is permitted, which is strange, given Italy's very strict smoking ban - and the communicating Salone Eva are nice for a drink in the evening with the live piano. The breakfast buffet at Salone Eva was very standard for 41 euro and should be improved. On the top floor, there is a terrace with a great view of Rome where they also serve drinks. The hotel has a good fitness room with natural day light, next to a lounge terrace overlooking the Spanish Steps. The sauna and steam room are unfortunately not complimentary (30 euro charge). Service was good but, unexpectedly, I did not find the staff to be the highlight of the hotel. Since there are very few such hotels left, is is difficult to compare, but the Hassler reminded me of two other gems: the Baur au Lac in Zurich and especially the Beau Rivage in Geneva. Expensive but more affordable out of season (see the Web site of the hotel or Leading Hotels).

Reviews.Title: “The Hassle”
Reviews.Author: hnya
Reviews.Content: Terrible all around: 1. Loud: Can hear other rooms and outside. Not enough insulation! 2. Food: Overpriced. 3. Interior: Fading and in need of renovation asap! 4. Staff: English skills terrible. 5. Infrastructure: Phone service useless (don't get connected after 20 rings), business centre computers don't work... and on and on... Next stop-Hotel de Russie. Leave the 'Hassle' behind...

Reviews.Title: “Rome's Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARtravel322
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple spent 2 wonderful nights at this beautiful hotel. Everything was perfect. We had arranged for airport pick-up by the Hassler and our very pleasant driver Gianmarco was waiting for us, helped us with our luggage and was very friendly and helpful. He gave us information about the city during our drive and got us there in very good time. Staff at the hotel were wonderful, we got some great tips from Dennis, our favourite concierge staff member, he always had perfect suggestions for us. Other concierge staff were excellent as well, helping us with other hotel reservations throughout Italy. The Palm Court Restaurant served an excellent, expensive, breakfast and the staff could not be more accommodating. The hotel is located right at the top of the Spanish steps, so perfect to be able to walk to many attractions. This hotel is definitely a high end hotel but well worth the splurge if you want the best hotel in Rome with the best location. We can't wait for a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect view”
Reviews.Author: juliecEngland
Reviews.Content: I've been to Italy on my honeymoon trip , visiting Firenze, Bologna and Roma. In Rome I have stayed at The Hotel Hassler, that I can reccommend to everybody for the incredible location, just at the top of Piazza di Spagna steps. Our room was amazing, I suggest to everybody to ask and stay in the high floor rooms to enjoy a terrific view of the city. The hotel is really expensive, but dining in the 6th floor restaurant has worth the price...!! Only negative note...the service was all right, but the personnel wasn't really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: 2009italy
Reviews.Content: Our Hassler experience began with a transfer they arranged from the airport...driver met us on time at the baggage claim with a sign, and was thoroughly delightful and personable...a great ambassador for his city, especially for first-time visitors like us. We had requested a room with a view and wow! what a view! The room was absolutely gorgeous, fitted with everything you could wish for and more. Bathroom was large and luxurious with lighting that made us 60+ folks look good! We had a spot of trouble with the wi-fi connection (free) but the hotel sent up a tech directly and he fixed it in a jiffy. Walking out on the balcony every morning to appreciate the panoramic view was incredible, and the beautiful weather didn't hurt a bit. Breakfast in the Palm Court, included in the price, was super delicious and the setting is lovely. The public rooms, in fact, are all very beautiful. The staff was gracious, friendly, efficient and professional. We loved them all. The location is wonderful - the double paned floor to ceiling windows kept the noise out at night - and we were able to go for a jog each morning before breakfast at the Pincio and across to the Borghese Gardens. There is a fabulous restaurant five minutes' walk from the hotel, just where the Pincio begins - Casina Valadier. Yikes, so beautiful and sooo yummy. We will be returning to the Hassler for sure...it's expensive but worth it in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Frenchchic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome twice in September. The first visit we stayed at the Hassler, the second we stayed elsewhere and wished we were back at the Hassler. Let's face it, anyone who's been there knows Rome is expensive. Sometimes you feel it's worth it and sometimes you don't. The Hassler is expensive, but it's definitely worth it. The rooms are sumptuous and completely updated: great beds, jacuzzi tubs, DVD players...the list goes on. The staff are polite and efficient. The restaurants are inviting and very good (try the Imago on the 6th floor, EXCELLENT! with a fantastic vegetarian menu - rare in Europe). If you're going to blow your travel budget on one excellent hotel in Rome, do it here. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kgr1
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely phenomenal stay from start to finish. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were probably the best I have ever stayed in. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful, especially the concierge who gave the most fantastic advice about all tourist attractions. It is located on top of the spanish steps, which not only provides a great work out, but of course a wonderful view. The only problem with this hotel is that no other will ever come close.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in a stunning setting atop the Spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: Gothampanda
Reviews.Content: After all we had heard about the Hotel Hassler over the years and on Trip Advisor, our expectations were very high. We found the best thing about the hotel to be a consistently high level of everything (service, room decor, cleanliness, professionalism) coupled with a spectacular location at the top of the Spanish steps - giving you a unique perspective on this city of hills (looking out to St. Peter's dome). Breakfast is served in a really lovely green outdoor courtyard. The food was OK, but a rather standard buffet and not what I would have expected from the rave reviews of the hotel. Rooms were fine, but not huge. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel and definitely stay here again, but adjust my expectations to be more realistic. This is a special place, but not the "greatest hotel ever" and certainly not inexpensive for leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “The most spectacular place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: luxadmirer
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the top floor in the most magnificent suite. It must have one of the best terraces in Rome with a great view and plenty of space. The staff were all extremely friendly and would definitely stay there here again!! It couldn't be better located for a shopping feast!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!! The Real Deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous!!! This is what you expect from a 5 star hotel. We had just arrived from 3 days in Venice at what we thought was a 5 star hotel, and we were greeted with sheer luxury. From location to ambiance to service to quality, this place gets all the high marks from us. They showed us 3 rooms all with different decor...and one was nicer than the next. The concierge was so helpful with reservations, directions, and suggestions. I have stayed in many fine hotels and I rank this up there with the best. A truly perfect experience that made our trip that much more enjoyable!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: kwh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hassler Roma for 9 days and enjoyed every minute of our stay. We did not have a view of the Roman skyline from our room, but we were on the 7th floor, which has a great terrace that overlooks Rome. The view from the terrace was sensational. We were out there every afternoon and evening. The staff was friendly and helpful in every way. The location is great, right at the top of the Spanish Steps. There is a little elevator that not everyone knows exists at the side of the Spanish Steps. It takes you down to the metro and the restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford the rates. It isn't cheap, but it is fabulous. I should also mention that the air conditioning in our room was really effective. It was great to come back from sightseeing and have a nice cool room in which to relax.

Reviews.Title: “My Cousin Vinny”
Reviews.Author: STUART444
Reviews.Content: After spending 6 great days at Palazzo Sasso in Ravello my wife and I went to Rome for 2 days before heading home. We had booked the deluxe room at the Hassler in Rome and were looking forward to ending our trip there We arrived at the Hassler, checked in and were given a room on the first floor overlooking the courtyard in front of the hotel. I asked the person that showed us our room (which was extremely small and claustrophobic) if it was going to be noisy and was told that there are triple windows, if we dont hear noise now there wont be any more noise We were sound asleep at 6:43 AM when were awoken to a huge noise of a truck passing by with glass bottles, sounded like it was in our room, just like in the movie My Cousin Vinnie. Every ten minutes after that for a half hour the same thing occurred, needless to say there would be no more sleep that morning I just feel for the kind of money they charge at the Hassler, this is grossly unfair If going to the Hassler ask for a room on the garden side, the noise level will be much less Other than that the hotel is beautiful, service is ok, location is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsCee95
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable hotel atop the Spanish Steps. This is a terrific location and this hotel is the best of the best. The service is extremely helpful (especially the concierge for dining reservations). The hotel is clean, well kept and gorgeous. My room was spacious with a king bed, couch and sitting area. We enjoyed the 7th floor terrace for cappuccino in the morning with its beautiful view of the city. There's a gym and spa - we used both and were very pleased. The garden terrace is excellent for breakfast. All in all, we loved this hotel and will visit again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Tip Top”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCrown
Reviews.Content: There are a few hotels in the world which once experienced will always draw you back when one happens to be in that city. If in London it has to be the Lanesborough, if in Bangkok the Oriental etc. I am very pleased to say that the Hassler is now firmly in that category. It is polished, welcoming and belle epoch +. It remains in private hands which is where it should stay. I would thoroughly recommend that one chooses a Rome city side view, our room overlooked the Spanish Steps which provided an eternal view on the city, watching the comings and goings of the constant activity below. Bed was brilliant, little short though.... Spa was lovely, try the hot stone massage. The Imago restaurant has utterly stunning food with views to match. Surprisingly there are a couple of things that do need addressing. The door isn't terribly well managed, the doormen seem to hide in a vestibule somewhere and aren't all that switched on to arrivals and opening the hotel doors or that of arriving cars. The hotel charges for things that similar standard hotels stopped charging for years ago; e.g. In room films, Internet, Mineral Water. A little arrogance in the Imago restaurant... kept us waiting for 35 minutes past our reservation without a bit of quid pro quo... All in all a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Hassler made our first trip to Italy even more memorable...”
Reviews.Author: dhurley
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hassler was simply marvelous! This was our first trip to Italy and staying at the Hassler made it so memorable. We have stayed in some of the best hotels in New York, Europe and all over the United States. The Hassler ranks at the top of its class. It is beautiful and charming, and has an understated elegance. The location is perfect. We had a gorgeous Grand Deluxe double room overlooking the Spanish Steps and the rooftops of Rome. From our room we could actually see the dome of St. Peter's Basilica. What a glorious sight at night! Also, April in Rome was just bursting with color from all of the spring blooms making it that much more spectacular. From the hotel you can walk everywhere: Via Condotti, Piazza de Popolo, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Via Veneto etc. There is also a beautiful outdoor terrace on the 7th floor where you can just sit and relax and take in the breathtaking views. My husband and I would unwind there with a glass of wine at the end of our day. La Dolce Vita! I would also like to mention the absolutely delicious buffet breakfasts-a definite highlight. One of the other many things we especially loved about the Hassler was the impeccable service. I can't imagine it being any better. You feel like royalty when you are there. The whole staff couldn't have been more accommodating and welcoming. Our special thanks to Roberto Coluccio at Reception and Ricardo at the Concierge desk. They took care of everything. I would also highly recommend the spa. The treatments are so luxurious and once again the service was wonderful.
