There is no question at all that we if we ever return to this fabulous city, we will no doubt go back to the Hotel Hassler. It was one of the nicest places we've ever stayed. Our thanks to all of the staff for making our first trip to Italy so special. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “2005 holiday”
Reviews.Author: flange8888
Reviews.Content: i was staying in Rome on a holiday with a girl that i mett on holidays while i was i Bali,i stayed in germany for 6 months and she took me to rome after being in germany for 3 weeks, i was looking for somewhere to ask her to to be my wife and that was the perfect place,we where not staying in the holtel but had dinner there and itwas a place that i will never feggett,i have stayed and had dinner in a lot of placebut this was the best, so a short time we lived here in australia but we ar not togeather anymore but still eating and being at the Harrler will always be with me and that night togeather as it doesent get any better than that night...regards steve.

Reviews.Title: “The Hassler is an elegant, luxury city hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsottile17
Reviews.Content: The Hassler is a great place to stay in Rome. It sits directly above the Spanish Steps. Our room was really nice. They have obviously redone them recently. The decor was very well thought out - everything went together. There was a panel of buttons on each nightstand for all of the lights in the room. The bar/minibar area below the tv was very elegant. The closet was great - it was like two large armoires that lit up when you opened then and had custom made shelves. The hotel is quite formal. I would not recommend it if you prefer a more comfortable atmosphere. We had the Continental Breakfast both mornings we were there. It was great for us - lots of cereal, fresh pastries, juices and fruit. We had an incredible dinner at Imago. One of the best meals that we have ever had. Also one of the most expensive :) I would definitely recommend the Hassler.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable stay”
Reviews.Author: cloeann
Reviews.Content: I treated my daughter and her friend to a European cruise this summer and we stayed at the Hassler for two days before boarding our cruise ship. The hotel could not have been better. I booked via e-mail with the Hotel and they had two connecting rooms for us that were perfect. And per my request, one room was even ready for us when we arrived at 9:30 am after our overnight flight. The hotel arranged for a drivier to pick us up at the airport, a personal guide for the following day and a driver to take us to cruise port. The location was perfect and my 18 year old and her friend loved seeing the US celebrities in the hotel. While the hotel was expensive it was worth every penny for the service we received. I will return whenever I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: DREAMGIRLY
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three week trip to Italy and Greece. We stayed four nights at the Hassler. It was a fabulous experience starting with the purple suite that had three plasma tv's. Wonderful breakfast each day and the location superb. The conceirge was great, but the best part was Alessandro, the manager of guest relations. Thank-you for making our stay incredible. She told us where to shop, worked with the conceirge one on one where to eat. They were always available for us and we will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: SBW-Raleigh-NC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hassler is fabulous. We were treated like royalty - the staff is superb! The rooms are lovely and quite spacious. The brunch is the BEST that I have ever had and is not to be missed. Hotel Hassler is located at the top of the Spanish Steps, within walking distance of so many sites. The roof top restaurant and bar is wonderful. A wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: M747
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hassler for a long weekend in November. Hotel is very centrally located on top of the Spanish steps, and has what you would expect from a top en hotel. We had a great room that was recently refurbished, large marble bathroom with separate shower and toilet. Comfortable bed and plasma TV on the wall. Great breakfast, and service at the bar in the evening. All in all a very nice stay in a very nice city. Highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for top of the line.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious room, stunning views!”
Reviews.Author: Casserole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hassler in Rome for 1 night on November 21st before departing on a Mediterranean cruise from Civitavecchia, Italy (45 minutes from Rome) I booked directly with the Hotel as they have a Last Minute Offer section on their website and had a very good rate available for a standard room including breakfast. I requested a room with a view of the Spanish Steps, if possible. We arrived at 2pm and our room was ready, it was on the 5th floor, quite small, very upscale with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in covered in huge pillows, thick carpet, towels, automtic draperies and best of all when we stepped on our balcony we had the most amazing view of the Spanish Steps! The concierge and check in staff were warm and friendly, we had breakfast in the restaurant just off the lobby (included) it was continental with coffee, tea, pastries, cereals & fruits etc... everthing was perfect. The location of the Hassler is just at the top of the Spanish Steps a wonderful area to walk around, shop, dine and soak in the atmosphere of Rome. Even if your room does not overlook the steps if you go up to the 7th floor where there is a large terrace with breathtaking views of Rome. We loved our stay at the Hassler and wished it was for longer, we would definately like to come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay! May be my favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LCWombat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hassler for 3 nights 17-20 Nov. I booked the hotel directly 8 months in advance, and asked for a room with a view and a king bed. We got both. The concierge was most polite in our email exchange, and reserved tickets for the Borghese Gallery for us, which we would not have been able to get had we waited until we arrived on 17 Nov. He handed the reservation number to me as I checked in. The reception staff welcomed us promptly, no waiting, and showed us to our room on the 5th floor (#506). The bags were brought up shortly thereafter. He explained all the functions of the room, from the bedside buttons that opened the curtains and dimmed the lights to the TV/wireless computer that was personnalized with our name. Then he showed us the balcony. I have to admit, I'm a bit of a romantic, and seeing the view from our small balcony almost made me cry. The bed was comfortable, the shower equipped with both the shower head and a separate spray handle for the tub. The tub was laid out like a lounge chair, and very comfortable. There was a full supply of toilettries - very nice. Hand towels were the size of normal bath sheets and the bath sheets (which were on the heated towel rack) were larger than most of my beach towels. If I wrapped it around me under my arms, they reached my ankels. Water pressure was good. Of course, big fluffy robes and slippers were provided. The maids did a nightly turndown service in addition to the daily cleaning, and folded any clothes we left out. Oh, for my fellow Americans, they had outlets for both Italian and American applicances, so we could charge our cameras and cell phone without adapters. We asked for a deluxe room, 1 step up from the entry room. I did notice some traffic noise on Monday & Tuesday am, but not on Sunday. It's a busy street , so some nosie is to be expected. Never noticed noise from inside the hotel. There were a lot of mirrors in the room, which gave it the appearance of being larger than it actually was. Still, we managed to get all 4 of our luggage from the cruise out from under foot. There was also a small hallway with a separate bedroom door, that we could close if we wanted to keep out noise from the hall. The bathroom was off this small hallway. Overall, not a bad size room for Europe. And the room was beautiful, and not overly feminine. There was a small relief decorating the wall, and lots of little touches to give the room a very elegant feel. Continental breakfast that was included in the price was also exceptional. Sevearl types of juice, bacon, sausage, veggies, scrambled eggs, multiple cereals, 5 types of yogurt, and lots of pastries. The service was spot on. Best coffee my husband had in Europe. I had tea. On 2 occassions, my husband called for ice, and it was borught wihtin 5 minutes along with spare glasses. Contrary to previous posts, we did not feel anyone was rude to us. When we asked for help finding a casual restaurant, the concierge gave us a map to help us find the place. Never had to wait for taxis, as there is a waiting area directly outside the hotel. The maid was nice enough to take a picture of us from the balcony for us. What not to expect - A pool. Large rooms if you book the entry rooms. Patrons tended to dress in what I would call "business casual", no T-shirts. It was cold outside, so no shorts of course. Do not expect a "fun" or party atmosphere. This hotel is elegant, and patrons act in a reserved, respectful manner towards other guests and the staff. Some may call it "Stuffy", but it was just what I wanted. As with most European hotels, no shower curtain - they have a glass wall to block the water. What to expect: World class service. I have stayed at so called "5-star" hotels before, but nothing has come close to the level of service I received here. They greated me by name every time we entered the lobby. They even start the revolving door for you. Everyone spoke English very well. Is it expensive - Yes. Is it worth it? That's your call. For me, the stay at the Hassler was the highlight of my European trip. We visited the St. Regis, which was our 2nd choice, just to see the difference, but decided we will stay at the Hassler again. For your reference, my travel background - I've traveled to all 7 continents, and stayed in everything from EconoLodges and youth hostels to overwater bunglows at Pearl Resorts in Tahiti/Bora Bora and the Royal Hawaiian on Oahu. In my 40's, married.

Reviews.Title: “Loved rome, hotel nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: traveltogetherwithu
Reviews.Content: Loved rome, but then again who does'nt? This hotel is not the first 5 star weve stayed in, but its the first I can say the staff are the most uncapable weve come across. We booked directly with the hotel and found the reservations quite rude on the phone, mostly surely for there lack of the Queens English. Will be back to Rome, left my coin in trevi fountain, will try another hotel, less over rated, over priced and with smiley faced staff.

Reviews.Title: “Never Expected This on a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Mac07London
Reviews.Content: I booked this for my family as a special treat for my wife and 8 year old daughter a couple of months in advance. Called two days before to reconfirm and setup car from airport. Hotel tells me upon arrival that they do not have my confirmed room and tells us we have to get back in the car and drive to a different hotel. Not only do they not honor the reservation but they also do not have the courtesy to contact my cell or the drivers cell and redirect us from airport. Absolutely unacceptable for a 5 Star Hotel not to manage their bookings appropriately and a low concern level for a family with small childrem. I usually stick with Leading Hotels of the World selections and this is the first time I have encountered this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice....but not that nice”
Reviews.Author: YandB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Hassler for 3 nights in October. We've been to Rome many times and stayed in a wide variety of hotels. (We got married there 2 years ago and had our wedding reception at The Majestic which, in our opinion, is a much nicer hotel). OK, the location is perfect. We had a room on the 1st Floor overlooking the Spanish Steps - great during the day but a nightmare at night / early mornings due to the noise. We can't blame the hotel for this - there was some building work going on outside the hotel and the sound of skips being loaded at 7 in the morning wasn't ideal. The room and bathroom were very small - not what we expected for over £400 per night. The staff forgot to replenish the towels twice which was also mildly irritating. Breakfast was VERY average. None of the staff seemed to know what they were doing so we'd be asked the same question by 3 different people in the space of a couple of minutes. The choice was also extremely limited and the quality was so-so. Without doubt The Hassler is a lovely hotel but, for the price, there are better places to stay. We're biased towards The Majestic but the rooms there are bigger and brighter, service is excellent and there's much more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Hassler - Overpriced and Overated”
Reviews.Author: SK1000
Reviews.Content: Just stayed last week for 4 nights. The location was great right on the Spanish Steps and thats about it. Our room overlooked a garden wall at the back, make sure you book a room on the top floor to get the views. The staff were OK , nothing great, and at breakfast make sure you hold onto your orange juice- the waiting staff kept removing them as though they don't want you to have more than 1 glass from the buffet. Rome itself is great a must see city, but having stayed at prestigious hotels across Europe - George V Paris, The Ritz etc, this place doesn''t stack up and its as pricey. I won't be going back to this hotel - but will go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: jln315
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Hassler for our honeymoon. This was my second trip to Rome and my first to the Hassler and I wouldn't stay anywhere else again! We were in room 508 on the top floor - the room was a little small but the view of the Spanish Steps and the decor were unbelievable. We got the honeymoon package which included breakfast every morning. To our delight, the breakfast is served (weather permitting) outside in the garden. You can also eat dinner in the garden or have drinks and snacks in the bar area. The staff was wonderul - they provided all the information we needed, made our dinner reservations and got us taxis in record time. You can't get better than the Hassler for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hassler Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Darby_House
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at the Hassler about 22 years ago. Back then, it was a low-key hotel with a frayed-around-the-edges kind of elegance. The Hassler has definitely changed--but I can't say the change is bad. The world has also changed. It is all glitz and glamour now--everything has been redone. Our room was fabulous--we were upgraded from the lowest grade room and it was one of the nicest rooms I've ever had--spacious and beautiful overlooking the Spanish Steps. The staff were gracious and helpful. The common areas, while not quite like they were before, were very nice and a new outside garden has been added where breakfast is served. This area also serves as the bar in the evening. If you have a chance, don't miss dinner at the hotel's terrace restaurant; the food is excellent and the view spectacular. Obviously, the restaurant is not cheap but I thought it was a good value, all considered. Further, I thought our stay at the Hassler was very reasonably priced compared to other hotels in Rome and Europe. I booked it on Expedia and it was one of the cheaper options--especially for this class of hotel. What more could one ask for?

Reviews.Title: “5 star paradise”
Reviews.Author: Yibbert
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hassler (right on top of the spanish step) is one of the most amazing places i have ever had the pleasure to stay in, the rooms are great, but the view (particularly in the front suites) is beyond words. The hotel is expensive , as is the restraunt but i felt it was well worth it. The staff were nothing but excellent and compared to other 'so called' 5 stars, this hotel did all the little extras. There is nothing i could really fault. Perfect - but please please do not ever go there because i want to go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo”
Reviews.Author: BHgirlCalifornia
Reviews.Content: When we got to rome, we were exusted (a loooonnngg flight from Beverly Hills Calif) they made every minute a pleasure for us. Wonderful service, and great views were what made this hotel so great. My kids loved the suite we were in. The rooms are simply sublime. Last time we were in Rome we stayed at the St. Regis, and it wasn't NEARLY as good. I recommend this hotel highly to anyone who likes first class service in one of the most beautiful hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jandstravel
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel EVER!!! I went there with my husband and we had the best time. Best location, food, and staff! This is by far my pick in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: BiscottiCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Simply put this hotel is exceptional across a wide variety of criteria... location, service, rooms, restaurants, staff... all amazing. We checked in on a Sunday night and were upgraded to a corner room with a small balcony overlooking the Spanish Steps. Bed was a sea of high thread count sheets and pillows. Bathroom had jacuzzi tub, shower, separate area for the commode and two sinks which made getting ready in the morning a breeze. The breakfast buffet which was included with our room was amazing. All the espresso and cappucino you can drink. Fresh baked pastries, and American breakfast items like eggs and bacon. When I return to Rome I'll stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service, views and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: julietz
Reviews.Content: we had our wedding in the Hassler and it was outstanding. the service was impeccable and views are the best we have ever seen. everyone was really accomodating and the food was sublime. our room was a suite with a private roof terrace looking directly over the spanish steps and again, phenominal views. A very big thank you to the Hassler for making our wedding such a memorable and special occasion. we would recommend this hotel more than highly to anyone wishing to stay in luxury and in a central position in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The only Hotel for a great Rome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: subatomicpower
Reviews.Content: We planned our trip to Italy as part of our cruise through the Med. Our embarkation port was Civitevecchia, which is a port city, and apparently not somewhere nice to stay. Rome was apparently only a 30 minute drive from the Port, and my wife and I wanted to experience the City with our two young girls, aged 7 & 10. We had read various reviews on Rome that varied considerably from "wonderful" to "horrific". A pattern that we did notice in our readings was that a wonderul time can be had in Rome...but it'll cost you. We stayed at the Hassler for three nights. Booking the hotel through direct email contact was direct, efficient and very polite. I booked several months in advance, and was guaranteed a reasonable ($586/night) for each of two adjoining rooms with a nice view of Rome. It is not possible in Rome to book in a "nicer", or "high end" hotel for 4 people in one room....this apparently has something to do with strict fire codes and the amount of people that are allowed to "officially" cohabitate per sq. meter. While I paid almost $1200 Euros per night for my two rooms at the Hassler, I feel that I easily got my money's worth. The hotel sent a very nice and capable driver to the airport to pick up my family. The cost of this service was $140 Euro, but was well worth it. The fellow was polite, efficient, friendly and very informative. We were aware of the fact that we were staying as guests in a very high-end, exclusive hotel, and that showing up looking like bedraggled riffraff was not acceptable. We were therefore attired smartly, and found the reception at the hotel was warm, friendly, efficient and motivated. We were shown immediately to our beautifully decorated, spacious and very well appointed rooms by a friendly concierge. Tipping in Rome is not like it is in America...the Concierge politely informed me that larger tips were greatly appreciated, but unnecessary. Smaller tips (a Euro or three) were sufficient. This information was greatly appreciated. The concierge was very helpful with providing maps and suggestions on what to see and how to get around. He even provided me with a jogging map of Rome, which was very nice! I probably jogged 10km per morning, and found that to be a beautiful experience! The view from our rooms was breathtaking, to say the least. The hotel is located at the top of the Spanish Steps, and the view is resultingly dramatic and unlike anything you could experience anywhere else in Rome. The streets in Rome (in the walled city)are very clean, and are cleaned daily by street cleaners. Outside of the walled city is a different matter. The beds were surprisingly comfortable, and the sheets were very high-end (800 thread count or higher). The towels were gigantic and very plush! The room was nicely air conditioned and was a welcome respite from the sometimes oppressive heat of Rome! We probably walked at least 20-30 km per day with our kids, enjoying ourselves at various piazzas along the way. When we required a taxi from the hotel, the concierge had one magically appear within 5 minutes of our request. One day, with little warning, the concierge was also able to magically have a tour guide meet us at the hotel to guide us through the Vatican (we still had to hire a taxi, which the concierge was also happy to arrange). The experience was amazing, and easily worth the $60 Euros/hour that the guide charged. Dinner on the rooftop of the hotel was breathtaking, as we were able to experience the setting sun over Rome in the middle of summer while we dined with our kids and our friends. The bill for dinner for the 8 of us (with wine and belini's) was about $700 Euros. The food was good (but could have been quite a bit better for the price we were paying), and the service was attentive, but slow to North American standards (service in Italy at restaurants is usually slow, as dinner is expected to take at least a couple of hours). Overall, it is a "once-in-a-lifetime" experience to dine at the Hassler's rooftop restaurant, but I found the food in the piazza restaurants to be quite a bit better. Breakfast was included with our rooms, and was served in a beautiful garden restaurant with friendly and attentive staff. The breakfast was absolutely fantastic (fresh juice selections, pastries, pancetta, eggs, etc., etc.). A great deal of care was taken to provide an excellent breakfast buffet, and it was a great way to start the day. I should note that a computer room with two computers and an unlimited connection to the internet was provided for hotel guests. You can pay half as much to stay at a cheaper hotel outside of the walled city, and waste half of your time and nerve saving a buck by taking the transit into the walled city (where everything is)...but by the time you do all that, half of your day is already gone and you have to ask yourself how much a portion of your vacation day is worth?...my experience is that you're much better off shelling out for a nicer experience and to "be" where everyone is trying to get to. We will definitely visit Rome again, and we will not hesitate to stay at the Hassler. The quality of our stay in Rome was definitely "made" by our wonderful experience at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hassler is Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: skullzmom
Reviews.Content: We go to Italy every summer to visit family and on the way stop in Rome for a few days at the Hassler. The rooms are absolutley beautiful and the service impeccable. Each room has it's own personality and the sheets and pillows are to die for. You will not want to get out of bed. It is also the finer details that make the Hassler a jewel...hand curled butter for breafkast, delicious appetizers with a drink in the bar...if you are looking for old world European class in an elegant setting, then the Hassler is for you!

Reviews.Title: “rave reviews Hotel Hassler”
Reviews.Author: mauna_kea_lady
Reviews.Content: we were very impressed with everything about this hotel; what a class act. we arrived amidst a taxi strike, and the hotel seamlessly arranged for their hotel limo to take us to an appointment - at taxi rates. the hotel room was glorious. breakfast was fabulous in their garden restaurant, and we were wowed by our dinner at Imago - their rooftop restaurant with drop dead views of Rome. The food at Imago was exceptional - sure to get a michelin star (or two) in the future. and surprise! the concierges were nice! really nice! and helpful! the hotel's location is perfect; next to the renowned Medici and Borghese gardens - and/or you can go down the spanish steps to all the designer shops. Last time we visited Rome we stayed at Hotel de Russie and enjoyed it very much, but the Hotel Hassler was even better. The hotel was perfect 24/7 for our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “"old world in a great location"”
Reviews.Author: 5stargirl
Reviews.Content: The Hassler has an old world feel to it - elegant, sedate, filled with antiques and heavy fabrics. The service is a bit stand offish - but nothing that an introductory tip doesn't cure. The housekeeping excellent, room service and maintenance fast and efficient, front desk very accommodating. The breakfast buffet on the main floor courtyard has enough selection of fruits, pastries, scrambled eggs and bacon, fresh juices and excellent cappucino to start the day quickly and sufficiently. The location at the top of the Spanish Steps is what I would say is the best part of the hotel. Although our suite did not have a view, the restaurant does, as does a small outdoor patio on the top floor. All the best shopping is at the bottom of the steps, and sights such as the Colosseum and Trevi Fountain are within an easy walking distance. I rated the Hassler as excellent as I cannot find fault in many things - even though it is very exepnsive, and staff are at first standoffish. They accommodated our room move with grace, the concierges made our bookings, and the door men courtious and polite. The appeal of this hotel is in it's "maturity" - it is not young and hip - it is seasoned and elegant. P.S. Excellent coffee and gelato at Antica Roma just down the steps and to the left.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Hassler”
Reviews.Author: Andrew2001
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Hassler. Location unbeatable - right at the top of the Spanish Steps. If you have a view of same so much the better - views otherwise would be non-existent. Room nicely furnished with all you need and very comfortable bed. It was my 40th birthday and the hotel sent up a bottle of fizz which a nice touch. Ate at the rooftop restaurant which not really worth the price, views notwithstanding. Driinks very expensive - seems a big divide in Rome between very reasonably priced or extortionate with not much middle ground. Overall, very expensive but worth it for the location and view - would hesitate if not guranteed room with a good view though.

Reviews.Title: “never will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mel76
Reviews.Content: Location great but would substitute it any time for pleasant helpful staff. I found the staff rude and unhelpful. I dont mind paying top prices to be looked after well but they seemed to just keep sticking their arm in. I wanted to go back to the colosseum after having enjoyed it on a previous trip. The conceirge was going to charge us an extortionate price to get a private guide to take us there. When I said there were guides up there to take people around he took exception to this and asked me did I really think there were people just standing around all day just to show me around. I replied that I did and he waved me away. I was proved right when umpteen guides offered us guided tours within minutes of getting off the metro. It just seems as if they just regard us as rich tourists there to extract the most amount of money possible. They pretend to have very limited local knowledge and just charge a fortune to get you on the most expensive trips possible. Not great for concierge staff. When asked to recommend us a nice bar they hadnt a clue either. Also when we got home from having dinner we decided to have a night cap at the bar before going to bed. 50 euros for two brandies. Outrageous. They can keep their superior atitudes and bad maners to themselves - i will never be back at the hassler

Reviews.Title: “great location with average service”
Reviews.Author: RST1974
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location with really beautiful rooms (although not cheap still some of the best rooms in Rome). Food is great by European standards. However, the standard of service really stops me giving the hassler 5 stars. The service was very average lots of small errors by staff, they also seemed very unapproachable. I agree that the charm and elegance of the hotel means that its proably still one of the best hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Cissy
Reviews.Content: As Rome is a frequent destination of at least once per year, I have stayed in various hotels in Rome. While I had stayed at the Hassler previously, during the past couple of years I had been staying at another of Romes top hotels. This past trip I decided to return to the Hassler - as I sort of missed it. I was extremely glad I did make that return to never stay anywhere else while in Rome. I had made my arrangements directly with the hotels website, my reservation request and all correspondance via email was handled expertly with no problems at all. I was also in touch with the concierge via email to arrange for a car and driver to pick me up upon my arrival at the airport along with a couple of restaurant reservations - again all handled expertly. When I arrived early in the morning at the Hassler my room was ready and I was quickly checked in and brought to my room - as well as being welcomed back. My room in the deluxe category was simply beautiful! Large with tasteful elegant decor - very old world European. I had requested a front room - to which I was given. The room had been recently renovated - updated. From the carpet on the floor being removed and the hardwood floor refinished to their new state of the art televsion that not only allows one to view television but also enables one to view movies, access the internet along with a built-in alarm clock. The bathroom in my room was also very large with lots of space to place ones toiletries and cosmetics. The room and bath were spotless in regard to cleanliness. Breakfast every morning was in the Salon Eva located on the main lobby floor. Wonderful fresh juices, fruit, yogurts and pastries - along with some cooked eggs - and if there was something more you needed they were more than happy to accomodate your request. The concierge staff is tops to say the least - with great restaurant recommendations. Being that I am a regular visitor to Rome I have been to many many of the top places - this trip I ate in restaurants that I have never been to before - all recommendations of the concierge. There were also a few of the concierge staff who were there when I was last at the Hassler - I was simply stunned when they remembered me. I also tried out two dining options at the Hassler - first being dinner at their Wine Academy just across from the hotel. The Wine Academy is owned by the Hassler hotel - when you enter you feel as if you are in a private dining club (which it sort of is). Very quiet, elegant, top food and excellent wines. I had my waiter pair my wines with each course of my meal and he did this perfectly. With dessert they also offer you their homemade digestives that are eclectic and quite good. I also decided to dine at the Wine Academy one day for lunch which was outdoors on their terrace and again just wonderful. My second dining option was at the hotels new(ly) renovated restaurant on the six floor. Forget that the view is simply breathtaking - the food is superb! I was not expecting the food to be as wonderful as it was - I was simply taken aback to how good it was. Each course was just amazing and their service top notch. Lots of interesting dishes to choose from and a very extensive wine list. I can honestly say that the food is definitely Michelin star worthy and I can only guess that in time they just may be added to the Rome list of Michelin star restaurants. All in all my stay at the Hassler was just excellent. One last little note, as I mentioned this is not my first time here, I was pleasantly surprised upon my arrival to find a bowl of fresh fruit along with a note from the general manager (owner) of the hotel to welcome me back. The Hassler has that very special old world feel of yesteryear. Elegance without pretention. The Hassler is now my home away from home while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Old World comes Alive again (newly Renovated)”
Reviews.Author: Travelinguy7
Reviews.Content: Ah, Rome, the food the history, the art! Everything one can imagine, Rome has. But when your feet are tired, your body aches from all the traveling etc, the Hotel is extremely important. Right in the Heart of Rome right off the Spanish is the Hassler Hotel. Newly renovated 2 years ago, food is 5 Star, especially from the roof garden. The rooms are nice size, and the beds are great. Service at the Hassle is 5 star, and you want for nothing. Work with the concerige for some of the best food in all of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hassler”
Reviews.Author: MGA1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were incredible. My favorite part of the hotel is the upstairs restaurant which offers the most panoramic view of Rome. The location is superb!

Reviews.Title: “The Hassler is FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: RomeTourist
Reviews.Content: We had a FABULOUS Stay!!! The Hassler represents everything you want from a hotel in Rome – elegant, romantic and fabulous location. Upon checking in my husband mentioned it was our anniversary and they automatically gave us an upgrade. Our room was beautiful with a balcony overlooking the Spanish Steps. The concierge gave great recommendations each night for dinner with smiles – they were so welcoming. We travel quite frequently to first class hotels and I HIGHLY recommend the Hassler. On a separate note, if you are looking for a private tour of the sites, check out the Rome Institute of Design. Our day touring Vatican City was the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djr76
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Il Palazzetto Wine Academy which is next to, owned by and run by the Hassler. This is the perfect place to rest your feet from the long walking days in Rome. You feel like you are in a boutique hotel but you get all of the benefits of a larger hotel. Huge room, beautifully appointed, right on the Spanish Steps...don't worry they have great windows to shield you from the noise!! Just an aside, this was the only hotel out of 8 that we stayed at during our trip that did anything to acknowledge that we were on our honeymoon. They gave us a bottle of wine when we checked in our room. The Wine Academy sets up a very swanky martini bar on top of their roof. Cool ambiance, great views. Can you imagine a better place to sip a martini?

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here!”
Reviews.Author: latraveller66
Reviews.Content: It is true the hotel is well situated (if you don't mind climbing the steps every time you want to go back to your room). We were given a room on the first floor which we obviously should have complained about but decided to keep it. It was very noisy and had no view at all. I really dislike hotels that decide they'll start by giving you the worst room they've got and see if you complain. Other hotels we loved in Italy gave us great rooms right from the start. But there's more. On our last night we found two giant roaches in the room. One of them in the bathroom and the other one dead belly-up in the room. Now I'm not squeamish but when you're paying $1000 a night for a room this is not what you expect. The worst part is when we were checking out, my girlfriend mentioned this to the staff and rather than apologize they just shrugged it off. There are MUCH BETTER hotels to stay at in Rome such as the hotel art or the hotel de russie.

Reviews.Title: “About the Hassler”
Reviews.Author: jack_us_dk
Reviews.Content: There's been some carping about the Hassler, which I'd like to respond to. I've been going to the Hassler for over thirty years, and there are certain things you have to understand. Like with many of the great hotels of the world, paying the rate just gets you in the door. As a guest you are scrutinized as much as you are scrutinizing the hotel. This is arguably the finest hotel in Rome, and it's guests should reflect it. While the Hassler does not require coats and ties in the lobby, it does have a minimum level of decorum, which should match the ambience of the hotel and the location. Remember, this hotel overlooks the Condotti. Americans have a hard time understanding this concept, but that's hardly the hotel's fault. 1. Dress accordingly. 2. Behave accordingly. This is not a hotel for kids or loudmouths. 3. The Hassler is not for price shoppers, so don't gripe about being "nickeled and dimed." 4. The hotel does tend to stick people towards the back. Specifically request a room towards the front and be prepared to pay for it. I've arrived looking like I belonged in a hostel and wound up over the service kitchen someone else mentioned. 5. The Hassler has maybe the best hotel restaurants in Italy. If you want to see Rome and die, the best place to do it may be the rooftop resaurant at sundown. 6. Be a repeat. They do keep track of their guests. I''ve had among the handsomest rooms and the kindest service of anywhere in the world. The last stay was no different. After climbing those Spanish Steps after a morning of walking the piazzas and shopping the Condotti, there's nothing like heading straight for the wonderful, serene bar off the reception and ordering a Bellini made from scratch. And there is nothing like getting dressed up later, then having dinner on the roof while watching the sun go down with the city at your feet. The above said, I do wish, after long last, that they'd renovate those "exile" rooms. Otherwise, I'd give them 5 stars.
